transliteration: yac ciddhi tvaṃ gṛhegṛha ulūkhalaka yujyase | iha dyumat tamaṃ vada jayatāmiva dundubhiḥ ||
translation_english: When in every house thou art set to thy work, O pestle, here give forth thy clearest sound — loud as the drum of conquering hosts.

sanskrit_text: उत स्म ते वनस्पते वातो वि वात्यग्रमित् । अथो इन्द्राय पातवे सुनु सोममुलूखल ॥
transliteration: uta sma te vanaspate vāto vi vātyagrāmit | atho indrāya pātave sunu somam ulūkhal ||
translation_english: O Sovran of the woodland, as the wind blows in front of thee, then for Indra’s drinking press the Soma juice, O pestle.

sanskrit_text: ता नो अद्य वनस्पती ऋष्वावृष्वेभिः सोतृभिः । इन्द्राय मधुमत्सुतम् ॥
transliteration: tā no adya vanaspatī ṛṣvā vṛṣvebhiḥ sotṛbhiḥ | indrāya madhumat sutam ||
translation_english: Today, O Woodland Lord, by the swift streams and the singers’ hymns, may the honeyed juice flow for Indra.

sanskrit_text: तानो असि गोरधि त्वचि पवित्रा सृज ॥
transliteration: tā no asi goradhi tvaci pavitrā sṛja ||
translation_english: Bring here, in thy purity and upon the cow‑hide, the Soma that remains from the pressing.

sanskrit_text: उच्छिष्टं सोमं पवित्र आ सृज नि धेहि गोरधि त्वचि ।
transliteration: uc chiṣṭaṃ somaṃ pavitra ā sṛja | ni dhehi gor adhi tvaci ||
translation_english: Place the remaining Soma, purified, upon the cow‑hide; pour it forth and fill us with radiance to the skin.

sanskrit_text: यच्चिद्धि सत्व सोमपा अनाशस्ता इव स्मसि । आ तू न इन्द्र शंसय गोष्वश्वेषु शुभ्रिषु सहस्रेṣu तुवीमघ ॥
transliteration: yac ciddhi satya somapā anāśastā iva smasi | ā tū na indra śaṃsaya goṣvaśveṣu śubhriṣu sahasreṣu tuvīm agha ||
translation_english: Even when the true Soma‑drinker seems as if undeserving, O Indra, do thou make us praised among cows and horses, in thousands, O rich‑bounteous one.

sanskrit_text: शिप्रिन्वजानां पते शचीवस्तव दंसना । आ तू न इन्द्र शंसय गोष्वश्वेषु शुभ्रिषु सहस्रेṣu तुवीमघ ॥
transliteration: śiprinvājānāṃ pate śacīvasta va daṃsanā | ā tū na indra śaṃsaya goṣvaśveṣu śubhriṣu sahasreṣu tuvīm agha ||
translation_english: O Lord of quick blessings, O mighty giver of wealth, may Indra make us praised among cows and bright horses in thousands, O rich‑bounteous one.

sanskrit_text: निर्वापस्मैतस्मन् सोर इन्द्र अस्तु ते प्रोह किरणैः । आ तू न इन्द्र शंसय गोष्वश्वेषु शुभ्रिषु सहस्रेṣu तुवीमघ ॥
transliteration: nirvāpasmaitasman sora indra astu te proha kiraṇaiḥ | ā tū na indra śaṃsaya goṣvaśveṣu śubhriṣu sahasreṣu tuvīm agha ||
translation_english: When the rapturous light has gone forth, may Indra be with us; do praise us among cows and bright horses in thousands, O rich‑bounteous one.

sanskrit_text: ससंतु त्याः अरातयो बोधन्तु शूर रातयः । आ तू न इन्द्र शंसय गोष्वश्वेषु शुभ्रिषु सहस्रेṣu तुवीमघ ॥
transliteration: sasantu tyāḥ arātayo bodhantu śūra rātayaḥ | ā tū na indra śaṃsaya goṣvaśveṣu śubhriṣu sahasreṣu tuvīm agha ||
translation_english: Let hostile forces lie in sleep, and let heroic geniuses awaken; O Indra, praise us among cows and fair horses in thousands, O rich‑bounteous one.

sanskrit_text: समिन्द्र गर्दभं मृण नुवन्तं पापयामुया । आ तू न इन्द्र शंसय गोष्वश्वेषु शुभ्रिषु सहस्रेṣu तुवीमघ ॥
transliteration: samindra gardabhaṃ mṛṇa nuvantaṃ pāpayāmuyā | ā tū na indra śaṃsaya goṣvaśveṣu śubhriṣu sahasreṣu tuvīm agha ||
translation_english: Slay with Indra the ass‑like spirit that grows against us with evil intent; O Indra, praise us among cows and bright horses in thousands, O rich‑bounteous one.

sanskrit_text: पतति कुन्डृणाच्याः दूरं वातो वना अधि । आ तू न इन्द्र शंसय गोष्वश्वेषु शुभ्रिषु सहस्रेṣu तुवीमघ ॥
transliteration: patati kuṇḍṛṇācyāḥ dūraṃ vāto vanā adhi | ā tū na indra śaṃsaya goṣvaśveṣu śubhriṣu sahasreṣu tuvīm agha ||
translation_english: May the winds blow far from our delights; do thou, Indra, praise us among cows and fair horses in thousands, O rich‑bounteous one.

sanskrit_text: ससंता याः उप सूर्ये याभिर्वा सूर्यः सह । ताः नः हिन्वन्तु अध्वरम् ॥
transliteration: saṃsantā yāḥ upa sūrye yābhir vā sūryaḥ saha | tāḥ naḥ hinvantu adhvaram ||
translation_english: Those powers that dwell near the sun or with it — may they destroy obstacles to our ritual and joy.

devata: Indra (with Aśvins and Uṣas in later verses)

sanskrit_text: आ व इन्द्रं क्रिविं यथा वाजयंतः शतक्रतुं । मंहिष्ठं सिंच इन्दुभिः ॥
transliteration: ā va indram krivim yathā vājayantaḥ śatakratum | maṃhiṣṭham siñca indubhiḥ ||
translation_english: Sprinkle Indra the strong slayer with nectar‑drops as one fattens a ram, until he reaches his full strength.

sanskrit_text: शतं वा यः शुचीनां सहस्रं वा समाशिराम् । एनिम्नं न रीयते ॥
transliteration: śataṃ vā yaḥ śucīnāṃ sahasraṃ vā samāśirām | enām na rīyate ||
translation_english: Whether a hundred of pure drops or a thousand flow, that stream of nectar never lessens.

sanskrit_text: सं यन्मदाय शुष्मिण एना ह्यस्योऽदरे समुद्रो न व्यचोदधे ॥
transliteration: saṃ yanmadāya śuṣmiṇa eṇā hy asyo’dare samudro na vyacodadhe ||
translation_english: As joy fills his belly like the sea, so never may it there be stirred away.

sanskrit_text: अयमुत ते समतसि कपोत इव गर्भधिम् । यदग्रे तव द्विजाः कृष्णेषु स्वस्तिषु ॥
transliteration: ayam uta te samatasi kapota iva garbhdhim | yadv agre tava dvijāḥ kṛṣṇeṣu svastiṣu ||
translation_english: As a dove returns to its nest, so may the thought of praise to thee remain with us in every blessing.

sanskrit_text: धनस्य पात्रधारिणो मनो विभुर्देवर्षिभिः समगः ॥
transliteration: dhanasya pātradhāriṇo mano vibhurd evarṣibhih samagaḥ ||
translation_english: Possessor of wealth, mighty in mind, thou art gathered with the seers of the gods.

sanskrit_text: स्थातुं जगता इव वृण्यताम् उदीरितम् इन्द्र विश्ववर्चसा ॥
transliteration: sthātuṃ jagatā iva vṛṇyatām udīritam indra viśvavarcasā ||
translation_english: Stand firm like the world‑supporting pole, O Indra, with thy abundant glory.

sanskrit_text: स नो हिरण्यरथं दंसनावा त्स नः सनीता सनये स नो दात् ॥
transliteration: sa no hiraṇyarathaṃ daṃsanāvā, tsa naḥ sanītā sanaye sa no dāt ||
translation_english: Grant us the bright chariot of riches, O Indra; be thou our giver from the assembled beneficent powers.

sanskrit_text: इन्द्राग्नी वर्धयतामेतानि यज्ञानि यज्ञं हन्तु यथा ॥
transliteration: indrāgnī vardhayatām etāni yajñāni yajñaṃ hantu yathā ||
translation_english: Indra and Agni, may these sacrifices prosper; as one smites foes, so let the rite be victorious.

sanskrit_text: ततः परि विश्वश्चाध्य धारयन्तु अमृतं मारुते अस्मान् ॥
transliteration: tataḥ pari viśvaś cādhy dhārayantu amṛtaṃ mārute asmān ||
translation_english: Then let the winds uphold for us that immortal delight all around.

sanskrit_text: आ ते वसुर्विश्ववारा शास्महे पुरुहूत सखे वसो जरितृभ्यः ॥
transliteration: ā te vasur viśvavārā śāsmahe puruhūta sakhe vaso jaritṛbhyaḥ ||
translation_english: Such we proclaim thee, O bearer of all riches, O friend of men, O Vasu invoked by the singers.

sanskrit_text: अस्माकं शिप्रिणीनां सोमपाः सोमपाव्नां सखे वज्रिन्तसखीनाम् ॥
transliteration: asmākaṃ śipriṇīnām somapāḥ somapāvnām sakhe vajrintsakhīnām ||
translation_english: O Indra, friend of heroes and of friends, thou art ours among the rapid drinkers of Soma.

sanskrit_text: रेवतीः नः सधामादे इन्द्रे सन्तु तुविवाजाः क्षुमन्तः याभिः मदेम ॥
transliteration: revatīḥ naḥ sadhāmāde indre santu tuvivājāḥ kṣumantaḥ yābhiḥ madema ||
translation_english: May those abundant plenitudes of Indra be ours in the common joy of drinking, O we who delight in the rapture.

sanskrit_text: आ अश्विनौ अश्वावत्या इषा यातम् शवीरया गोमददस्रा हिरण्यवत् ॥
transliteration: ā aśvinau aśvāvatyā iṣā yātam śavīrayā gomadadasrā hiraṇyavat ||
translation_english: O Aśvins, come with the wealth of horses, with your impelling force and with rich herds of cows.

sanskrit_text: समायोजनः हि वाम् रथः दस्रौ अमर्त्यः समुद्रे अश्विना ईयते ॥
transliteration: samāna‑yojanaḥ hi vām rathaḥ dasrau amartyaḥ samudre aśvinā īyate ||
translation_english: For your immortal chariot equally yoked is carried over the sea, O Aśvins.

sanskrit_text: उषा उवि दिवा उषसो दीना यस्य जन्तुर्विश्वः ॥
transliteration: uṣā uvi divā uṣaso dīnā yasya jantur viśvaḥ ||
translation_english: O Dawn, at the spreading of day, whose creatures are all the worlds.

sanskrit_text: दैव्यं मते जुष्टो वशे तिरो अतस्ते दीयते ॥
transliteration: daivyaṃ mate juṣṭo vaśe tiro ataste dīyate ||
translation_english: Radiant Dawn, revered in the divine thought, shine forth for us with beauty.

sanskrit_text: तं त्वा त्येभिः आ गहि वाजेभिः दुधितः दिवः अस्मे इतिirayim नि धारय ॥
transliteration: tvam tyebhiḥ ā gahi vājebhiḥ duhhitaḥ divaḥ asme iti rayim ni dhāraya ||
translation_english: O Dawn, bring down thy plenitudes with those riches; hold that wealth in us, O Daughter of Heaven.

sanskrit_text: अन्ये रमन्ते तिष्ठन्तः पश्यन्तः उषसो दिवः प्रजाः ॥
transliteration: anye ramante tiṣṭhantaḥ paśyantaḥ uṣaso divas prajāḥ ||
translation_english: Others rejoice and stand in sight of Dawn’s brilliance and the life it gives.

sanskrit_text: विभन्ति जियन्ति जम्मनानामध्वरम् इव ॥
transliteration: vibhanti jiyanti jammanānām adhvaram iva ||
translation_english: They prosper and live as though upheld by the sacred order.

sanskrit_text: तेजसा वः प्रसारयतु प्रीत्ये तपसा च दिवो भुवनः ॥
transliteration: tejasā vaḥ prasārayatu prītye tapasā ca divo bhuvanaḥ ||
translation_english: May the brightness of heaven and earth expand for your joy and heat.

sanskrit_text: उषस्व यत्र जनयन्ति दिवस्य रश्मीनां विशोधयन्तो भुवम् ॥
transliteration: uṣasva yatra janayanti divasya raśmīnāṃ viśodhayanto bhuvam ||
translation_english: O Dawn’s beams, where they generate and purify the world, bring life to us.

sanskrit_text: आ गच्छ दिवा दिवं यत्रास्मा जनयन्ति वै विश्वतः ॥
transliteration: ā gaccha divā divaṃ yatrāsmā janayanti vai viśvataḥ ||
translation_english: Come, O Dawn, to the light where all beings are born from everywhere.
